thread.title: This is the Year You'll Learn to Make Dumplings (Dough and All)
thread.title_full: This is the Year You'll Learn to Make Dumplings (Dough and All)

author: Anna Francese Gass
title: This is the Year You'll Learn to Make Dumplings (Dough and All)
text:
If you like it, save it! 
Save and organize all of the stuff you love in one place. Got it! 
Click the heart, it's called favoriting. Favorite the stuff you like. Got it! ✉ Email 
As we finish up the first month of the New Year, I’m thinking about new traditions and celebrations to add to my life based on what I’ve learned cooking with immigrant grandmothers. 
Recently, I learned to make pork dumplings, a northern Chinese dish cooked every year to celebrate Chinese New Year, from a woman in my community named Tina. She told me how each year, all the women in her family gather to shape and cook the dumplings. They’d eat as they went, making more as needed. Advertisement Tina's Delicious Chinese Dumplings by Anna Francese Gass 
Tina gave me a few very important tips to great dumplings. First, she always makes the skins very thin, so that when you eat a dumpling, the outside melts in your mouth and you can really taste the savory pork filling. She also stressed the importance of ginger, which intensely flavors the meat. 
But what I found most interesting is Tina’s secret ingredient: She adds a 1/4 cup of soft tofu, minced fine, to the pork . She finds that the ground pork from the grocery store is much leaner than what she would get in China or Chinatown, but the tofu adds some much needed moisture to the mix. ♥ + How to Make Dumplings Without a Recipe by Ali Slagle 
These dumplings are very versatile: Boil, steam, or pan-fry them based on your liking. To serve, Tina puts some soy sauce and hot chili sauce on the table so that each person can have them as savory or spicy as they like. Advertisement 
With Chinese New Year right around the corner on January 28, I can’t wait to make a nice big batch of dumplings to serve to my family. The new year never tasted so good. Tina's Delicious Chinese Dumplings
